3/ Protocol Perspective: @cysic_xyz  Network â€” A Proof Layer under PoC Consensus

Cysic Network uses a 4-layer modular architecture:
1ï¸âƒ£ Hardware Layer â€” CPU, GPU, ASIC, portable devices
2ï¸âƒ£ Consensus Layer â€” Cosmos CDK + modified CometBFT + Proof-of-Compute (PoC)
3ï¸âƒ£ Execution Layer â€” EVM-compatible smart contracts for task routing
4ï¸âƒ£ Product Layer â€” ZK, AI, Mining, HPC

ğŸ§© PoC = Compute is Consensus
Validator weight = compute contribution + stake â†’ unifying computational & economic security.

â€¢ Prover (Compute Core) â€” High-intensity proof generation, 10 CYS collateral, GPU/ASIC or Digital Harvester hardware.
â€¢ Verifier (Light Participant) â€” Lightweight validation tasks, 0.5 CYS stake, runs on PC/Server/Android.

â†’ GPUs offer flexibility & cost efficiency

ğŸ”¹ ASIC Track:

1/ Three Routes of ZK Hardware Acceleration âš™ï¸

â€¢ GPU â€” general-purpose & mature (CUDA/PyTorch), best current option but limited by memory/bandwidth.
â€¢ FPGA â€” flexible & low-latency, great for iteration but poor scale economics.
â€¢ ASIC â€” custom-built for max efficiency; once ZK standards settle, it becomes the endgame.

8ï¸âƒ£ Optimize Strategy
Split big orders into smaller chunks.

tweets.author: 0xjacobzhao

tweets.content:
7ï¸âƒ£ Risk Controls
PT principal is safe only if underlying is safe.
Stablecoin depeg = full PT risk.
YT counterparty risk: when YT demand overheats, PT yield looks great but collapses once YT unwinds.
Exit risk: do you have liquidity to sell PT early, or must you wait until maturity?
tweets.author: 0xjacobzhao

tweets.content:
6ï¸âƒ£ Gas & Fees
Ethereum gas = $3â€“10 per swap.
For a 10d PT with only 0.3â€“0.5% yield, gas can erase most of the profit.
Gas-adjusted APY must remain attractive before committing.
tweets.author: 0xjacobzhao

tweets.content:
5ï¸âƒ£ Execution Path
Direct USDC â†’ PT often = double slippage (USDCâ†’alUSDâ†’PT).
Alternative: swap USDC â†’ underlying (e.g. alUSD) first, then buy PT.
Always test both paths in preview, compare outcomes.
tweets.author: 0xjacobzhao

tweets.content:
4ï¸âƒ£ Position Sizing & Liquidity
Rule of thumb: trade â‰¤2â€“3% of pool TVL per order.
Minimum size: $5k+ (otherwise gas eats the yield).
New pools show 20%+ APY, but thatâ€™s only valid for tiny trades (hundreds of $).
Big orders crush the curve â†’ actual APY drops to single digits.

Effective cost per PT
Net return at maturity

Short-term PTs (â‰¤30d): high implied APY possible, but gas costs matter more.
Long-term PTs (90d+): more stable returns, less impacted by gas.

@pendle_fi  PT/YT design unlocks 4 major strategy paths, each matching different risk appetites:

ğŸ”¹ Fixed Income (PT Strategy)
Buy PT (Principal Token) at a discount â†’ redeem 1:1 at maturity.
Effectively an on-chain zero-coupon bond.
Lock in fixed yield, no surprises.
âœ… Best for conservative investors
âš ï¸ Risk: opportunity cost if yields rise elsewhere.

ğŸ”¹ Yield Speculation (YT Strategy)
Buy YT (Yield Token) â†’ entitled to all yield until maturity.
YT = a pure play on future yields.
If staking APR or lending rates rise, YT appreciates.
If yields collapse â†’ YT can trend toward 0.
âœ… High-risk, high-reward.
âš ï¸ Requires strong views on rate trends.

ğŸ”¹ Curve Arbitrage
PT & YT have maturities (e.g., 1M, 3M, 6M).
Sometimes mispricings occur across different tenors.
Arbitrage = long undervalued PT/YT, short overvalued one â†’ capture spread.
âœ… Market-neutral strategy
âš ï¸ Requires active monitoring + execution skill.

ğŸ”¹ Leveraged Yield
Use PT or YT as collateral in lending protocols.
Borrow stables or ETH â†’ loop back into PT or YT positions.
Goal: amplify returns by stacking exposure.
âœ… Boosts APY significantly
âš ï¸ Adds liquidation & smart contract risk

tweets.content:
Undoubtedly, @pendle_fi is one of the most successful DeFi projects of this cycle (alongside @ethena_labs and @HyperliquidX). At the same time, Pendle strategies are highly complex.

This research report is one of my most rewarding works this monthâ€”I finally feel Iâ€™ve fully mapped out the rational strategies for @pendle_fi 's  PT, YT, and AMM pools across different market phases. The report also extends into decision trees for different risk profiles, a systematic analysis of coin-denominated strategies, and even explores the more advanced Boros strategy.

A month ago in my AgentFi report (localhost:8080/0xjacobzhao/status/195â€¦), I predicted a strong alignment between Pendle strategies and AgentFi. To my surprise, @gizatechxyz had already started exploring Pendle ETH PT agents half a year ago. tweets.content:
3.5/Crypto Treasuries vs. Luna
Two models. Two feedback loops. One survived, one collapsed. Letâ€™s break it down ğŸ‘‡

ğŸ§µAssets
Treasuries: Backed by BTC & ETH â€” real value, real liquidity.
Luna: UST + LUNA â€” algo-peg, no external backing.
ğŸ§µ Valuation
Treasuries: Stock cap tied to NAV, moves with macro, financing, sentiment.
Luna: Mint/burn mechanism â†’ needs endless demand to stay afloat.

ğŸš€Positive Flywheel
Treasuries: mNAV > 1 â†’ issue shares â†’ buy BTC â†’ BTCâ†‘ â†’ NAVâ†‘ â†’ stockâ†‘ (asset expansion flywheel).
Luna: UST demandâ†‘ â†’ LUNA burn â†’ priceâ†‘ â†’ confidenceâ†‘ â†’ more UST demand.
âš ï¸Negative Spiral
Treasuries: mNAV < 1 â†’ stockâ†“ â†’ investor sell-off â†’ BTC dumped â†’ NAV shrinks â†’ stockâ†“ (volatility amplifier).
Luna: UST depeg â†’ panic sell â†’ USTâ†“ â†’ LUNA hyperinflate â†’ instant collapse.
âš ï¸Risk Profile
Treasuries: Amplify downturns, but BTC/ETH wonâ€™t go to zero.
Luna: Systemic collapse. Once broken â†’ straight to zero.

âœ…System Impact
Treasuries: Interlinked w/ TradFi (Fed policy, stock liquidity).
Luna: Closed crypto loop. No external stabilizers.

âœ…Endgame
Treasuries: Worst case = stock crash + BTC sell pressure â†’ more volatility, assets still exist.
Luna: Worst case = total wipeout.

Bottom Line: Treasuries â‰  Luna, They are bridges to TradFi and compliance. But in downturns, they flip from capital gateways â†’ volatility amplifiers.
tweets.author: 0xjacobzhao

tweets.content:
3/ Treasury selloffs in downturns â€“ whatâ€™s the risk?

mNAV = Enterprise Value Ã· Net Asset Value
EV = market cap + debt + preferred stock â€“ cash
NAV = value of crypto holdings at current prices
This ratio = the heartbeat of every treasury company.

When mNAV > 1 (premium):
Market pays for growth, brand, financing ability â†’ Company issues shares â†’ raises cash â†’ buys BTC/ETH â†’ Buying pressure lifts BTC â†’ NAV grows â†’ stock rises
ğŸ‘‰ The Asset Expansion Flywheel (see: MicroStrategy).

When mNAV < 1 (discount):
Market questions valuation â†’ Stock falls â†’ investors sell harder â†’ Company may dump BTC/ETH to defend ratio â†’ Selling drives BTC lower â†’ NAV shrinks â†’ stock falls more
ğŸ‘‰ Thatâ€™s the path to a death spiral.

This looks like a balance-sheet recession in TradFiâ€”
but in crypto it plays out faster and sharper.
Some firms may try share buybacks (raise BTC per share), but not all have that option.

ğŸ§µ ã€Deep Diveã€‘From zkVM to the Open Proof Market  @RiscZero Ã— @boundless_xyz

Zero-knowledge proofs (ZK) are becoming the cornerstone of verifiable computation in blockchain, with a clearer trajectory and use cases emerging:

âš¡ï¸ Three pillars: scalability (Rollups, zkEVM, zkVM), privacy (payments, governance, identity), interoperability (cross-chain, data proofs).

ğŸ›  Tech evolution: zkRollup â†’ zkEVM â†’ general-purpose zkVM (RISC-V, LLVM IR, Wasm) â†’ zkCoprocessor â†’ zkMarketplace.

ğŸš€ @RiscZero   leverages RISC-V to build its zkVM, extends with the Steel coprocessor and Bonsai high-performance network, and evolves into @boundless_xyz , a decentralized proof marketplaceâ€”turning ZK computation into a tradable commodity. We also compare Risc Zero vs Succinct, and the trade-offs between RISC-V and Wasm approaches.

While the ZK sector faces short-term cooling and limited demand, in the long run the commoditization and infrastructural maturation of ZK are set to drive the next industry cycle of opportunity.

Letâ€™s dive in ğŸ§
